Fields.DialogueText: We're under attack! Everyone; with me!
Sagate kudasai, Kanchou! Watashi zenbu makasete! Miina wo mamorimasu!
@BATTLE
Fine fighting, Hōshō! And not a scratch to be found on anyone! You're really coming into your role as a protector of the people.
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou. I feel like my life has new meaning now that I am able to prove myself useful to others.
Not only have you helped others rise from the ashes, but you seem to have done so yourself!
As fond as I am of the lore of the Phoenix, it only reincarnates in Greek mythology. We have different ideas where I come from.
How so?
Lots of ways! Luck, transition, peace... Would you like to hear about any one in particular?

Fields.MenuText: Luck.
Transition.
Peace.

Fields.DialogueText: It's said that anyone who witnesses the Hō-ō will be blessed with good fortune. In some cases, their deepest wishes may also come true!
The appearance of the Hō-ō is often linked to rebirth, but in a different way. For example, the bird may appear after the birth of a future virtuous leader who will lead the world into prosperity!
The Hō-ō are creatures of peace that would never do harm. I'm not much like a phoenix in that regard...
How interesting. Well, I can certainly see myself as being lucky for falling into your company. And, despite fighting almost daily, we ARE aiming to one day secure peace.
Un! It's all just speculation anyway. I am much more than a small subset of characteristics! There's no need to pigeon-hole me... Phoenix-hole...?
Regardless, good work today. You did great.
Kanchou mo otsukaresamadeshita.
After your fine display in rescuing our stranded captain and his crew, we've been tasked with yet another defensive operation.
Ready and willing!
We'll be escorting a convoy ship through Morgana territory. The ship has only token defenses. That's where we come in.
Wakarimashita.
The ship must come to no harm until it reaches the final port on its route. There'll be respites along the way where we can resupply, but these will be few and far between.
Hai! I knew we were destined for something important, Kanchou. You can feel the excitement in the crew's every step!

Fields.MenuText: I'll be relying on you again.

Fields.DialogueText: Ganbarimasu! You are not the first kanchou I've seen through difficult times.
This will doubtless be a good opportunity to test the limits of your phoenix powers.
Not the resurrection again, I hope.
If we are to be successful, I have a feeling we're going to need all the luck we can muster!
Tasshikani! You learn quickly, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
How about a quick warm-up for the road ahead?
Ikimashō!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you can handle that?

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron desu! If we can come to a daring rescue, it will be easy to defend a vessel that stays by our side!

Fields.MenuText: Any questions?

Fields.DialogueText: Iie. Daijōbudesu!
I'm shipshape and the crew are raring to go, Kanchou. It almost feels like my maiden voyage again.
A busy crew is a happy crew. Luckily, in wartime, the work never seems to stop.
Still, I long for the day we can let the sails down and cruise peacefully around the Pacific.

Fields.MenuText: You don't approve of war?

Fields.DialogueText: Does anyone?
True enough.
I know some Kami favor the battlefield more than others, but I'm sure most of them would agree that needless bloodshed is never a good thing.

Fields.MenuText: What will you do after the war?

Fields.DialogueText: I want to bathe in a piping hot onsen once more. The steam takes years off you, Kanchou - you have to try it!

Fields.MenuText: You mentioned before that the phoenix was typically an advocate of peace.

Fields.DialogueText: Sōdesu. They are said to escape to the heavens in times of bloodshed before returning during peacetime. As tempting as that sounds, I cannot leave the crew behind to fend for themselves.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Apologies, I may have to ask you to break your vow of pacifism.
Anshinshite kudasai, Kanchou. Although I would never raise a hand to any man, woman, or child, these foul monsters are a different matter entirely!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Ima isogashii desu ka?
I always have time for you. Come in.
Do you remember during our last mission, when I offered you a good luck charm to aid in the battles ahead?
Of course. I always keep it close by.
I thought, perhaps, as the war rages on and becomes ever more intense, you would benefit from an additional trinket or two...
How kind. I would gladly accept any charm you would--
*KLANG*
How many accessories are you planning on giving me?!
Gomennasai! I just thought it was better to be safe than sorry!

Fields.MenuText: As a phoenix, shouldn't you naturally exude luck?

Fields.DialogueText: Someone as ordinary as me couldn't possibly hope to match such mythological levels of luck. These charms give me a much-needed power boost.
I find it hard to think of them as anything more than placebos...

Fields.MenuText: If we have to fight, it's nice thinking we can do so with lady luck on our side.

Fields.DialogueText: As mentioned, the phoenix is rarely seen on the battlefield. I hope my presence can bring about peace... or at least hope.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose these charms just "drifted into your life" like the last one you gave me, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: That's right. Lucky desu ne?
Dish these out to the crew, if you don't mind. I still have the original charm you gave me. With you by my side, I have all the luck I need.
*ALARM*
Let's put these to the test, shall we?
Hai!
@BATTLE
This will be our final stop before meeting with the convoy ship.
Let's make sure we get everything we need here. We may not be able to touch land again for sometime.
In which case, should we consider the purchasing of new weaponry? We may need additional resources to thoroughly protect such a defenseless escort.
*ALARM*
Kanchou! Kikimashita?
I heard it all the way from here! Quickly, let's return to the ship!
@BATTLE
I don't think all the Belle Magic in the world could get us refitted in time.

Fields.MenuText: And we didn't exactly come into this unprepared.
Besides, do you really want the crew to be trying to train on new guns in the middle of a high-risk escort run?
... Plus, I already checked. They don't have anything we need.

Fields.DialogueText: Loading preparations are almost complete, Kanchou.
Very good. Is there anything we need before heading out?
Actually... I was meaning to say...
That look tells me my wallet is about to take a significant hit...
There was a silk painter we passed earlier today...

Fields.MenuText: Come now, you can tell me.
Need a new sail?

Fields.DialogueText: Iie! Zenzen mondai nai desu! Demo...
Naraba...

Fields.MenuText: I think I know where this is going...

Fields.DialogueText: If you wouldn't mind...
Some of the designs of her silks were beautiful, Kanchou.
That they were. Especially that bird of paradise one...
Watashi mo suki datta! I thought... if the budget would allow it... we could purchase a few.
I doubt they'll see the light of day. Isn't it too risky to have aboard, what with the storms and Morganas?
I don't plan on using them during wartime. When we sail the globe after the war is won; that is where they will shine the most bright.
How can I say no to such a proposal?
Arigatō gozaimasu, Kanchou!
Make the purchase and then return to the ship. We need to clear out any Morganas circling the exit before we depart.
Wakarimashita! I think ten or twenty silks should suffice! Ittekimasu!
I only meant one or two! *Sigh* That girl might be the incarnation of misfortune rather than luck... At least as far as my budget is concerned...
@BATTLE
Rhetorical question.
And besides, if I can keep a bird alive, I can keep some fabric intact.
Hajimemashita, Kanchou!
You seem to be in good health.
We've had it smooth sailing so far. However, we'll be soon entering into Morgana territory and won't be able to defend ourselves.
In order to maxmize the transport load, we've done away with almost all our weaponry aside from the bare minimum. We'll be relying on you to grant us safe passage.
And we'll be happy to oblige.
What do you suggest we do first, young lady? We are entirely under your command.
Eh? Etto... Jya... Please lead the way...
Lead the way? You heard we have no defenses, right?
Tasshikani... Jya, Kanchou, what do you think we should...

Fields.MenuText: *Wink*

Fields.DialogueText: Right... atarimaeda... Please lead the way. We can support you from behind without issue. If you are ambushed from the flank, we won't be able to turn and help.
You're the boss. You heard the girl, men! To your positions!

Fields.MenuText: You've got this.
Don't doubt yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: What happened there? You're not usually so flustered when it comes to making calls.
That's only when I'm with you, Kanchou... My troubled past has left me doubting every decision I make... I am happy to live for others, but the responsibility is still a lot to take on...
I won't coddle you into feeling good about yourself. There will come a time when I won't be there to support your decision. When that time comes, I'm sure you'll make the right call.
Hai!
*ALARM*
They're starting early today! Quickly, defend the convoy!
@BATTLE
Maybe, in my prime, I could have thrown caution to the wind and acted on instinct. But now... I'm not sure I can.
Things are pretty quiet.
A little too quiet...
There ain't a Morgana in sight! You should really be leading this charge, no?
Ano...! Etto...
*BOOM*
What the hell?!
We've been hit, Kanchou! Behind us!
Look ahead! There, ten o'clock!
There's even more of them!

Fields.MenuText: Can you fight that many?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure I can! Even the greatest of vessels would struggle to take down such a fleet while prioritizing defense.

Fields.MenuText: It's an ambush!

Fields.DialogueText: Protect the convoy at all costs!

Fields.MenuText: Can you see the captain? Is he all right?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe so. The ships in front of us are still quite a ways off.
If we can't fight them...
Kanchou! I have an idea! Do you remember the stranded captain we helped during our last mission?
How could I forget?
Say we take his practice and draw the Morganas toward us. The convoy can then slip around and escape unscathed.
You want to taunt an entire fleet?!
We won't fight for now, at least. We'll escape and look for cover!
Did you hear that?!
Ryōkai!
Let's make it happen!
@BATTLE
I think we managed to lose them somehow...
And we all got out of it relatively unscathed. Although the hull did take quite the battering.
Yappari... My decision has landed us in hot water yet again...

Fields.MenuText: I thought I told you to never second guess yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: How should I learn from my mistakes if I do not dwell on them? Constantly... without remorse... sinking deeper and deeper into regret and despair until--

Fields.MenuText: Not everything will go according to plan in war.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose... Perhaps if I had thought about things a little harder, then--

Fields.MenuText: I allowed your plan to go ahead. Are you questioning my judgment too?

Fields.DialogueText: Definitely not! I just think... if things had gone a little differently, then maybe--
Enough!
Kanchou?
You did well out there. Your quick thinking allowed us to escape from the Morganas and protect the convoy.
Demo--
Not to mention that, if we had listened to our guest and placed the convoy behind us, they would have been damaged without us having the time to turn and help them!
Kanchou...
Your plan saved us. You should be proud!
Wipe that grin off your face. We still have to reconvene with the convoy.
I thought you said you weren't going to coddle me, Kanchou...
Don't get used to it.
@BATTLE
We've nearly lost them! Don't let up until we're out of sight!
*BZZZZZ*
Yes, we're glad to hear you made it out safely.
Is that...?
*Nodding*
Ah! Yokatta desu!
If you continue onwards and we'll meet you at the first designated dock.
Could I speak with them briefly, Kanchou?
Uh-huh... Yes... Understood. Before you go, I was wondering if you could quickly listen to--
*BZZZZZ*
Hello...?
Yappari, okorimasu yo ne...

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure he's not angry. Probably just a bad connection.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for trying to comfort me. White lies are always the sweetest.

Fields.MenuText: He has no right to be angry.

Fields.DialogueText: His crew were endangered because of me. Regardless of the outcome, I'm sure you would feel the same were I put in peril's way.

Fields.MenuText: I'll have a word with him after we dock.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, but I don't need you to fight my battles for me. I will face up to him and state my case.
The dock shouldn't be too far off now. Let's continue on and take out any Morganas along the way. We must ensure a safe docking for the convoy.
Hai!
@BATTLE
We managed to make it relatively unscathed.
The convoy ship is already here as well. But where is the--
What an absolute disaster!
Captain. You made it back okay?
We docked about thirty minutes or so before you arrived. Luckily, the Funayūrei circling the dock had dispersed.
Captain!
You! I have something I need to say to you!
Mōshiwake gozaimasen! My decision put the lives of you and your crew in grave danger! I have no excuses and can only offer my deepest--
Put her there!
Your plan to lure the Funayūrei away from us may very well be the reason we're standing here right now. I agreed to let you take the reins, and then I questioned the orders I was given.
Demo--
If we were behind you, we would have been sitting ducks! I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for keeping my men alive. From here on out, we'll follow you into any hell you name!

Fields.MenuText: Well, isn't that nice, Hōshō? Anything you have to say?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Dōitashimashite!

Fields.MenuText: What happened on the radio? You hung up when I mentioned Hōshō.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? Probably just a bad signal, I bet!

Fields.MenuText: I'm lucky to have her.

Fields.DialogueText: You've got yourself a fine companion there. Make sure you keep hold of her.
We'll be heading back onto the ship now. Several Funayūrei look to be circling the outside waters. Best you take them out before we proceed.
Leave it to us.
Hai!
@BATTLE
The Funayūrei seem to be dwindling more by the day.
Maybe you're more lucky than you realize.
I'm still having a hard time accepting that our escape was not plain luck.
Shall we put it to the test?
How do you...? Ah, Ii desu yo!
Saisho wa gū...
Janken pon!

Fields.MenuText: [Throw Gū]
[Throw Paa]
[Throw Choki]

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Paa! I win!
Ha! Choki! I win!
Ha! Gū! I win!
Nothing more than a coincidence! Let's go again!
Kamawanai! Aiko Desho!
*ALARM*
Rock, Paper, Scissors, Morgana seems a little one-sided, does it not?
You forgot to include the Funayūrei counter, Kanchou! A primed Kami ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Kanchou? You wanted to see me? What is all this?
I've gathered most of the crew here to put my speculation to rest. There is no conceivable way for you to beat every person here in Janken without some kind of magical ability.
Kanchou... Hazukashii desu yo...
This is no time for embarrassment! Let's see just how lucky you really are!
*ALARM*
Shouldn't that be evidence enough of my lack of good luck?
@BATTLE
Janken pon!
Ah! Kachimashita. Sumimasen!
Sugi!
Janken pon!
Gomennasai matta kachimashita!

Fields.MenuText: You sailors are an embarrassment to the sport!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't blame the crew, Kanchou! This is essentially out of our control!

Fields.MenuText: You have to be cheating!

Fields.DialogueText: How dare you, Kanchou! I have never once cheated at anything in my entire life!

Fields.MenuText: Why do you keep apologizing?!

Fields.DialogueText: Shikataganai! The crew look so upset when they lose...
*100 OR SO DEFEATED CREW LATER*
That does it. If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself. Please allow me one final rematch.
Kanchou... Why are you so fired up...?
Never in all my years at sea; through countless siren sightings, kraken shadows beneath the waves, and storms conjured by Poseidon himself...
... Have I ever been more convinced that something supernatural is occuring on this ship!
*Sigh* Very well. In that case, let us play our final...
*Whisper whisper* How great is this? With Hōshō's power of luck, we can't possibly lose a fight!
*Whisper whisper* I know! It's like traveling with a god beside you!
Hōshō? Are you ready?
Hai? Ah, hai, ikimashō!
Saisho wa gū!
Janken!
Pon!
Kanchou? You wanted to see me?
Please take a seat.
Is something the matter?
Why did you let me win?
Hai?
I could see it in your eyes. You threw later than usual. You saw my hand moving and deliberately chose the wrong option.
*Sigh* I've been found out...
Why?
If I were to win, the crew would become complacent. Luck is always a godsend when it favors you, but it should never be relied upon.

Fields.MenuText: The crew were awfully intrigued by your skill at Janken.

Fields.DialogueText: It was nothing but a coincidence.

Fields.MenuText: You don't believe yourself to be lucky?

Fields.DialogueText: No more than anyone else.

Fields.MenuText: Then why do you carry so many good luck charms?

Fields.DialogueText: My good luck charms are only meant to boost our odds of success.
To multiply those odds, we still need to have at least 1% of effort as a base for the charms to have any effect, no? Zero times zero is still zero.
I will keep hold of my charms, as I have grown quite attached to them over the years. However, I think for me to move forward, I need to stop relying on luck and rely more on myself.
Well, whether luck exists or it doesn't, I consider myself lucky to have met you.
I feel the same way, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Care to join me?
Hai!
@BATTLE
We made it to our final pit stop without much obstruction.
This will be our last chance to gather supplies before the final push.
Kanchou, mite kudasai.
Hm? Where?
In that tree. It looks like that young fledgling is about to leave the nest for the first time.
So it is.
Ah! There it goes! Iina~ I wonder if Tori is still flying high above the clouds.
I'm sure he is.
I'd love to soar like that one day. How freeing it must be.

Fields.MenuText: You should have joined the air force if you had such aspirations.

Fields.DialogueText: I love the sea more than words can tell... but the grass is always greener, isn't it?
Listen, I've met a few aviators since all this started. After the war is over, I'll try and book you a tour of the sky - even if it's just circling around over your deck.
Sugoi! Let's go together!
Right, now let's clear out any Morganas and get back out to sea.
Hai!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I thought you were able to perceive at least some of what your planes experience. Belle Magic and all that.

Fields.DialogueText: Like a dream, yes. And, like a dream, the memory fades quickly.

Fields.MenuText: Better you than me. I can't stand heights - even looking off the edge of your flight deck gives me chills.

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't ever let you fall, you know.
Much appreciated.
At this rate, we should reach our destination without needing to fight a single ship.
Something doesn't feel right, Kanchou.
What do you mean?
That fleet from earlier. We managed to escape them, but they did not vanish into thin air.

Fields.MenuText: Are you saying we should be prepared for another ambush?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm saying it's within the realm of possibility.

Fields.MenuText: Let's be sure to keep an eye on our rear this time.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll stand guard at the back of the ship just to be sure.

Fields.MenuText: You're sure you couldn't take them on?

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps if I did not have to worry about defending the convoy, it would be possible.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Where?!
Koko desu, Kanchou! They're attack from behind again!
We're ready this time! Defend the convoy!
@BATTLE
There's too many of them!
Don't let up yet! We can't let them reach the convoy!
Quickly, everyone! Find somewhere to avoid the incoming barrage!
Hōshō, look out!
*KABOOM*
Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: *Cough cough*

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, are you injured?! Why would you do something so reckless!

Fields.MenuText: Are you all right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm fine. What about you?!

Fields.MenuText: That was a close one.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you're injured, please save your strength.
*THUD*
Your leg is bleeding but you should pull through.
I'm feeling dizzy...
It's likely the blood loss. Hang in there and we'll get you patched up.
Give... give...
Give? Give what?!
Give them hell...
Kanchou? Kanchou?! Quickly, Kanchou has fallen unconscious. Take him to his quarters!
We're dying out here! What are your orders?!
Kanchou has been injured, so--
I asked for YOUR orders!
... Retreat for now! We must preserve the convoy and as many lives as possible!
Got it!
Hang in there, Kanchou...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, are you feeling better?
Much better, thanks to your nursing skills.
This is no time to be joking around. We barely made it out of that pinch alive. We're still being tailed and it's only a matter of time before the Funayūrei catch up to us.
Apologies. You seemed stressed, so I wanted to lighten the mood.
Of course I'm stressed! Why would you do something so reckless! You know I can defend myself and am much more durable than you. What on Earth was going through your mind?!

Fields.MenuText: I saw you in danger and couldn't stop myself from moving.
Sometimes you need to trust your gut instinct.
In that moment, all I could think about was protecting you.

Fields.DialogueText: Please have some restraint next time...
That's hardly an excuse...
What are you saying at a time like this...?
I won't be able to move for some time, it seems.
The convoy captain has been asking for our next move. What should I tell him?
I'm kind of sleepy, to be honest. I think I better take a nap.
Kanchou...?
Too... tired... to lead... crew.
Kanchou!
Believe in yourself. When the time comes, I know you'll make the right call.
Kan--
*SNORE*
*ALARM*
Yosh. I won't let you down.
@BATTLE
The port is almost within sight!
We're nearly there! One final push!
*ALARM*
Bah! And we were so close too!
They're tailing us. We can't lead them to the port. We need to divert our course for now!
Aye-aye!
If only we had a way to sink the entire fleet in one quick motion... Ah, Kanchou, you're up and about again?
I couldn't miss your finest hour, now, could I? Besides, there's supposed to be a beautiful reef nearby. If we are to meet our makers here, I'd like to see it before I die.
Kanchou, that's it!
Come again?
I have an idea to defeat the Funayūrei. But it's going to take a lot of luck.

Fields.MenuText: Didn't you tell me there's no such thing?

Fields.DialogueText: Right! I need to trust myself!

Fields.MenuText: I'm behind you 100% as long as you believe in yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Right. We don't need luck. This plan will work.

Fields.MenuText: My charm is ready to go!

Fields.DialogueText: On second thoughts, keep it hidden, Kanchou. We won't need luck. This plan will work!
What do you need us to do?
For now, please provide cover fire. I need to grab something from my room.
You heard the girl! Stall for you lives!
@BATTLE
Here, Kanchou. Please proceed to hand these out to everyone.
What are...? The silks you bought from the port?
I must have bought about twenty... no, thirty in total! Please tell the crew to attach these horizontally across the entire ship.

Fields.MenuText: What are you planning?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd rather not say. I fear that if you knew what I was planning, you'd sooner abandon ship.

Fields.MenuText: Aye-aye.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for trusting me.

Fields.MenuText: Should I fear for my life?

Fields.DialogueText: Most definitely. But that comes with the job, doesn't it?
What about the convoy ship?
Please find somewhere to hide yourself! We can provide a smokescreen with which you can escape! We'll rendezvous at the port!
Got it! Make sure you come back to us alive!
Are you ready, Kanchou?
As I'll ever be!
In that case, full steam ahead! Aim for the reef!
@BATTLE
Keep it steady! Drop the smokescreen now. We need to blind them!
When the captain agreed to let you lead him into hell, I don't remember signing my name as well!
Keep firing! Don't let up! Create as much smoke as possible!
@BATTLE
We're nearly at the reef's edge!
Keep moving forward!

Fields.MenuText: We're going to swerve at the last second, right? Right?!

Fields.DialogueText: ... IKE!

Fields.MenuText: Are you mad?

Fields.DialogueText: You said you trust me, right? Monku iwanaide!

Fields.MenuText: Tell my family I love them!

Fields.DialogueText: Tell them yourself! We're not dying today!
Don't tell me...
Ima da! Raise the sails and kill the engines!
We're going through?!
Tobe!!
Kanchou. You can open your eyes now.
We're... not dead?
Far from it. Also, could you please stop clinging to me so tightly? It's getting hard to breathe.
What happened?
Mite kudasai. With our engines stalled, we are invisible and inaudible.
And... the silks? We're sailing with the wind?
I'm a big ship, but my math worked out. The wind is catching the sails and drawing our course just clear of the reef.

Fields.MenuText: How far are we from the convoy ship?

Fields.DialogueText: We should be less than thirty minutes from the rendezvous point.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry for doubting you.

Fields.DialogueText: Iie. Thank you for believing in me enough to sign off on such a crazy plan.

Fields.MenuText: If only we could do this in the sky...

Fields.DialogueText: It would be wonderful to spend a lifetime seeing what Tori sees.
I never thought I would be able to relive my glory days like this... I was ready to accept a graceful decline into retirement.
You seem to keep gracefully declining upwards.
Iie, Kanchou. Forget what I said earlier. You've given me a second chance to fly, and I won't squander it fretting about the past. We're not sailing. We're flying!
Safe and sound. Quickly, retrive the sails! Who knows when we'll need to ride the wind again!
The convoy ship should have arrived by now. They have enough weaponry to fend off one or two Funayūrei, but even cornered these monsters are dangerous!
@BATTLE
Thanks to the smoke, the Funayūrei are following our previous course and getting caught in the reef without even knowing it's there.
You made it! You crazy sons of... You actually made it!
Sorry we kept you.
Is the convoy damaged at all?
Not a scratch. We have you to thank for it. You are one lucky Kami.
Much apprec--
Luck had nothing to do with it. It was a well-executed plan concocted by a seasoned war veteran.
Kanchou...
Please continue to do your utmost for the war effort!
You too, ship lady. I'm proud to have worked beside you.
Come on. No rest for the wicked. Let's get back out to see and await further orders.
Hai! Leave any Funayūrei blocking our exit to me!
@BATTLE
I can't argue with that.

Fields.MenuText: I should hope not.
It's been a pleasure working with you.
Okay, enough chit-chat. We all have duties to attend to.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh.
No word yet about our next assignment?
I'm just happy to enjoy a moment's peace.
Say what you want, but at least our lives are never boring!
I suppose you're right. Say, do you often worry about being past your prime?
Where's this coming from?
You mentioned it before. When we nearly died.
Ah! So I did...

Fields.MenuText: Are you so worried about not being able to live up to your past achievements?

Fields.DialogueText: "Past achievements" is a strong term for scraping by. I was a lot more confident back then. I miss it.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you need to worry so much. You did great out there.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't help but think the old me would have sprung into action and made the call much earlier.
And old you may have suffered the consequences for that. Wisdom comes with age.
Are you calling me old?
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: If you don't want to talk about it, please feel free to stop me.

Fields.DialogueText: Uun. Hanashitai.
Saved by the bell. Let's deal with these Morganas and continue our discussion up top.
Hai!
Phew! That's the last of them. What an adventure these past few weeks have been!
What was your highlight?

Fields.MenuText: How could it not be sailing on the wind like in the olden days?

Fields.DialogueText: It got me thinking of Tori all over again! I hope he's okay.

Fields.MenuText: The Janken tournament was quite lively.

Fields.DialogueText: So it was!

Fields.MenuText: Leaping to your rescue.

Fields.DialogueText: Please never do something so reckless again!
@BATTLE
We've nearly dispatched them! Continue to fight until the final Morgana sinks!
I hope you've learned to trust yourself more and not rely on luck to carry us through difficult situations.
That I have. Whether I decline gracefully beneath the waters or soar into the heavens remains to be seen.
But, whichever way I enter into the afterlife, I will do so on my own terms.
And I will be right there beside you.
Yoroshiku onegaishimasu!
